list1_facilityname.facilityname2: 201-A Interim Office Building, Irvine, California, 92697-5444, US

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Air Travel Paid by University Estimated emissions based on percent change of 2015 air travel emissions.

Source Emissions | Commuting Calculated by our Parking and Transportation Services group using sample data already collected for regional air board reporting purposes. Data includes faculty and staff commuting, vendors, students, and student employees. CH4 and N2O were calculated using transportation emission factors from TCR Table 13.9. CH4 =13,900 MT CO2 x 0.0000591 CH4/CO2 x GWP (28) = 23 MT CO2e N2O = 13,900 MT CO2 x 0.0000357 N2O/CO2 x GWP (265) = 131.5 MT CO2e

Source Emissions | Electricity Distribution System Operation and Maintenance Based on measured usage of 9.1 lbs. 9.1/2204.62 = 0.00413 Used an insulating gas in 12,000-Volt campus-owned electrical distribution system switches, transformers, and other equipment.

Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption B20 (Biodiesel Portion) Fleet emissions for 2017 based on 2016 emissions. Data was not collected by fleet services due to change in manager. Default factor of 128,000 Btu/gallon for biodiesel 71,607 gallons of B20 consumed, of which 14,321.4 gallons (20%) is B100. Therefore 1,833.14 MMBtu was used. 14,231.4 gal x 9.45 kg/gal = 134,486.73 kg (134.867 tonnes) CH4 emissions and N20 emissions were calculated with the #2 Diesel portion.

Detail.EndUseSector: Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption B20 Biodiesel (Diesel Portion) Calculated per Table 13.9 of the General Reporting Protocol SEM using CO2 value derived from the total CO2 from both the ULSD and Biodiesel portions of the B20 fuel. CO2 from fuel consumption = 57,286 (total B20 fuel tank volume in gallons) x 10.21 kg CO2/gal x 1 tonne/1000kg = 584.885976 tonnes. CH4 CO2e = (125.741892 + 584.885976) x 5.91E-05 CH4/CO2 x GWP = 1.19182 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = (125.741892 + 584.885976) x 3.57E-05 N2O/CO2 x GWP = 6.81368 MT CO2e

Detail.EndUseSector: Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption CNG 2017 consumption 1318 GGE CNG GGE CNG CO2 = (1318 GGE CNG x 0.05444 kg/SCF x 126.67 SCF/GGE CNG)/1000 kg/MT = 9.09 MT Calculated per Table 13.6 of the General Reporting Protocol SEM using CO2 value derived from the total 0.000737 kg CH4/mile 0.00005 kg N2O/mile fuel economy 30 miles/CGE (Honda Accord CNG model) CH4 CO2e = 1318 GGE x 30 miles/GGE x 0.000737 kg CH4/mile x GWP = 1.02186 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = 1318 GGE x 30 miles/GGE x 0.00005 kg N2O/mile x GWP = 0.65614 MT CO2e

Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption Motor Gasoline 109,761 gallons sold to campus tanks plus 7,821 gallons sold through the Voyager Card for a total of 117,582 gallons Calculated per Table 13.9 of the General Reporting Protocol SEM using CO2 value derived from the total CH4 = 5.91E-05 CH4/CO2 N2O = 3.57E-05 N2O/CO2 CH4 CO2e = 117,582 gallons x 5.91E-05 CH4/CO2 x GWP (28) = 1.708364 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = 117,582 gallons x 3.57E-05 N2O/CO2 x GWP (265) = 9.76684 MT CO2e

Detail.EndUseSector: Gasoline Light Trucks (Vans, Pickup Trucks, SUVs)
Gasoline Light Trucks (Vans, Pickup Trucks, SUVs)
Gasoline Light Trucks (Vans, Pickup Trucks, SUVs)

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption Propane Calculated per Table 13.6 of the General Reporting Protocol SEM using CO2 value derived from the total Propane = 2,195 GGE CH4 Propane = 0.000066 kg CH4/mile N2O Propane = 0.000175 kg N2O/mile 16.5 miles/GGE Ford F-150 Propane light duty truck (similar to street sweeper) CH4 CO2e = 2,195 GGE x 16.5 miles/GGE x 0.000066 kg CH4/mile x 0.001 MT/kg x GWP (28) = 0.06693 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = 2,195 GGE x 16.5 miles/GGE x 0.000175 kg N2O/mile x 0.001 MT/kg x GWP (265) = 1.679587 MT CO2e

Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption ULSD Vehicles Highway Use Off campus use with Voyager Card was 1,671 gallons for 2016 Calculated per Table 13.9 of the General Reporting Protocol SEM using CO2 value derived from the total 5.91E-05 CH4/CO2 3.57E-05 N2O/CO2 CH4 CO2e = 1,671 gallons x 10.21 kg CO2/gal x 0.001 MT/kg x 5.91E-05 CH4/CO2 x GWP (28) = 0.028224 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = 1,671 gallons x 10.21 kg CO2/gal x 0.001 MT/kg x 3.57E-05 CH4/CO2 x GWP (265) = 0.161385 MT CO2e

Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption Ultra Low Sulfur Diesel Fuel 48,955 total gallons used from the ULSD tanks minus standby generators usage (12,614.6 gallons) and off campus Voyager card usage (1,671 gallons) is 34,669.4 gallons. the subtracted usage is reported separately. CH4 conversion factor = 5.91 x 10-5 CH4/CO2 N2O conversion factor = 3.57 x 10-5 N2O/CO2 CH4 CO2e = 357.716539 CO2 x 5.91 x 10-5 CH4/CO2 x GWP (28) = 0.591948 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = 357.716539 CO2 x 5.91 x 10-5 CH4/CO2 x GWP (265) = 3.38405 MT CO2e

Source Emissions | Operation and Maintenance of Standby Generators The usage by campus standby and emergency diesel generators was 12,248.1 gallons. CH4 and N2O emission factors from EPA for diesel were used to calculate CH4 (0.00041 kg CH4/gal) and N2O (0.00008 kg N2O/gal) CH4 CO2e = 12,248.1 gallons x 0.00041 kg CH4/gal x 0.001 MT/kg x GWP (28) = 0.140616 MT CO2e N2O CO2e = 12,248.1 gallons x 0.00008 kg N2O/gal x 0.001 MT/kg x GWP (265) = 0.2597 MT CO2e Nearly 100% of use is for code-required testing of the generators.
Source Emissions | Process Emissions Based on previous year's usage of bottled N2O, CH4, and CO2 in laboratories on main campus.
Source Emissions | Purchased Electricity-Location Based

Source Emissions | Purchased Electricity-Market Based From University California Office of President Energy Service Unit: Emissions factor for direct access accounts based on TCR's Electric Power Sector Protocol (CO2 only) CO2= .0945 tons/MWh: 2,805.739 MWh = 265.14 mtCO2e CH4(33 lbs/GWh): 2.805 GWh X .01497 = .042002 N2O (4 lbs/GWh): 2.805 GWh x .00184 = .005163
Source Emissions | Refrigeration Systems Operation and Maintenance 1870.14 lb HFC-134A/2204.62 lb/mt = .848 194 lb R-404A/2204.62 = .087 83 lb R407-C/2204.62 = .37
Source Emissions | Renewable Energy Credits - Market Based
Source Emissions | Stationary Combustion The total use in the campus core was 13,059527 therms for 2017.

list1_facilityname.facilityname2: 101 The City Drive, Orange, California, 92868, US

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Commuting Calculated using a methodology acceptable to the California Air Resources Board (CARB) for CO2. Default transportation emission factors (Table 13.9) were used to convert CO2 to CH4 and N2O for the GHG amounts listed above.

Source Emissions | Fleet Fuel Consumption ULSD Vehicles Highway Use The UCI Medical Center purchased 351 gal of diesel fuel for use in their fleet during the 2017 reporting period. The GHG emissions are calculated from Table 13.9 in the TCR Default Emission Factors document.

Source Emissions | LPG Gas Usage The UCI Medical Center purchased 21.9 gal of liquid propane for fleet usage during the 2017 reporting period. The EPA GHG Emission Factors (https://www.epa.gov/sites/production/files/2015-07/documents/emission-factors_2014.pdf) were used to determine CH4 and N2O emissions. Table 13.9

Source Emissions | Medical Center Vehicle Fleet The UCI Medical Center purchased 4,566 gallons of unleaded fuel during the 2017 reporting period for use in the fleet vehicles. The default factors for the transportation sector from table 13.9 were used to calculate GHG for CH4 and N2O.

Detail.EndUseSector: Gasoline Light Trucks (Vans, Pickup Trucks, SUVs)
Gasoline Light Trucks (Vans, Pickup Trucks, SUVs)
Gasoline Light Trucks (Vans, Pickup Trucks, SUVs)

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Operation and Maintenance of Standby Generators The UCI Medical Center used 756 gal of diesel fuel in the 2017 reporting period for regular testing of a fleet of large emergency diesel generators. Factors from EPA Emission Factors for GHG Inventories Other Diesel Sources = 0.26 g/gallon and the default value of 138,000 Btu/gallon to calculate the 1.884 g/MMBtu.
Source Emissions | Purchased Electricity-Location Based

Source Emissions | Purchased Electricity-Market Based Emissions factor for direct access accounts based on TCR's Electric Power Sector Protocol (CO2 only) From UCOP: CO2= .0945 tons/MWh: 35,909.973 MWh = 3,393.49 mtCO2e CH4= (33 lbs/GWh): 35.9097 GWh X .01497 = .5376 N2O= (4 lbs/GWh): 35.9097 GWh x .00184 = .0066
Source Emissions | Refrigeration Systems Operations and Maintenance
Source Emissions | Stationary Combustion
